intro: Epilobium junceum f. canescens, commonly known as the gray willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, reddish-purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from June to August. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or along stream banks. This subspecies is distinguished by its grayish-blue foliage, which gives it its common name.
